message.content:
Now I understand the performance issue! In the `update_feed_url` function in `app.py`, we call `fetch_feed(new_url)` on line 861, but then later on line 886 we call `fetch_and_update_feed(feed.id)` which internally calls `fetch_feed(feed.url)` again. This results in a redundant network request.

Let me update the task tracker and start fixing the first issue:

function.arguments: {"command": "plan", "task_list": [{"id": 1, "description": "Fix performance issue in backend - avoid redundant network call in update_feed_url function", "status": "in_progress"}, {"id": 2, "description": "Improve frontend API configuration to use relative URLs for production", "status": "todo"}, {"id": 3, "description": "Enhance error handling in frontend to display submission errors in edit modal", "status": "todo"}, {"id": 4, "description": "Run full test suite to verify all changes work correctly", "status": "todo"}, {"id": 5, "description": "Update documentation files (CHANGELOG.md, TODO.md) as needed", "status": "todo"}]}
function.name: task_tracker
